website_summaries.verdict: Most of those who have tested the New Balance 890 v6 liked its fresh looks, its lightweight nature and its breathable upper. The midsole gained some positive feedback, as well. But there were those who noticed the unusual stiffness of the platform and the awkwardly tight toe box. It’s a divisive neutral running shoe for the road, but it’s mostly welcomed by its purchasers.
pros: The underfoot cushioning offered by the New Balance 890 v6 was lauded by a heavyset tester, stating that it suitably carried the foot
Several consumers noted that the façade looked visually appealing
Some people stated that it offered a lightweight and an agreeable response during low and medium-mile runs
The breathability of the upper worked well, according to some purchasers
The traction capacity of the outsole proved reliable, based on user feedback
cons: Most reviewers felt that the underfoot platform was unusually stiff
The toe box was a bit snugger than expected, a few runners reported

customer_reviews.title: A bit of a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I have owned four pairs of 890v4's and several v'3s. I run approximately thirty miles per week. I have loved the previous versions like no other and especially for its lightweight. This newer version has a heavier feel to it. Also the tongue is made of thinner material and not as padded as the other versions and I find myself having to keep loosening and retighten the lases because they hurt the top of my foot because of the thinner tounge. Not a bad sneaker but not the feel of the previous version. It was disappointing since I have been faithful and loved this version for the past ten years.
customer_reviews.author: mastriano michael

customer_reviews.title: Very Dissapointed....Not what I expect from New Balance Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am a loyal New Balance shoe guy. I have 5 pairs in my closet and I wear New Balance shoes to officiate high school and junior college football. I wore this pair of shoes for the first time this past Sunday. They were not comfortable after about 2 hours and I was not on my feet very long. I bought and insole and wore them all day yesterday. My feet were sore last night. This is not what I normal for New Balance Shoes. I would not recommend THIS STYLE. No issue with New Balance....but these are not up to their standard. If I had saved the box I would have returned them.....do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: never had a problem with New balance shoes for 6 years
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It fits as expected, feels great to walk in them. High air permeability and durable, as always. Neutral: the toe-tip of the shoe has this weird running slant that allows you to step into strides better(?)..not sure if its a great feature or not,but its a different running-shoe-feel. Cons: Breaking them in was hard to do--the higher-neck of the heal gave me bad blisters on both feet. Probably the neck of the heal goes up too high. never tried running in them...Im afraid it'll just leave more blisters if I would try to run, but will break-in and cause less blisters overtime. Not sure if id run in these, but I will wear them at work.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Felt a little small out of the box, but adjusted nicely over the past 5 miles and fits very comfortably now. Very lightweight and maneuverable; I hardly know I'm wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Neuwirth

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe but didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I have a bad right knee with ACL reconstructed and 60% meniscus removed so I needed a good support for running. I was moving from Asics GT2000. This NB running ahoe was ranked among top 5 in an article. Although it fit nice it wasn't very comfortable for long runs. I used for 2 months, ran a 13.1 in 2.11, but didn't really feel very comfortable and stability, comfort and support was not up to my liking. I switched to Asics Gel Kayano 24 and very next week ran a 13.1 in 1.59. I am going to stick to Asics for my runs and use this casually for walks and theme park visits.
customer_reviews.author: VJ

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality I expected
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if NB quality went down or I received knock offs but these are terrible. The plastic that they use to shape the shoes in the toe box is warped and the left heel is collapsing on the inside of the shoe making them worthless. I've been wearing NB for over 15 years and this pair has given me pause from ever buying another pair.
customer_reviews.author: danno16

customer_reviews.title: First time a New Balance shoe did not fit
customer_reviews.text: I have been a lifelong New Balance shoe owner, but the 890v6 did not fit my foot - I tried my usual size and a size up, but both were too narrow in the front of the foot. I've never encountered that issue before. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Excellent everyday running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been an avid ASIC running shoe fan for over 20 years. I finally decided to try a New Balance shoe for training since I do own a pair of NB racing flats. I decided to give the 890-V6 a try based on a few positive reviews and I must say these running sneakers are fantastic! They have great support and feel really light , additionally the upper mesh allows for breathability. I feel like I’m running on marshmallows . In fact, I like them so much I bought another pair within a months time. I think I’m going to be buying NB from this day forward!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, fits great
customer_reviews.text: Glad to find my favorite color and perfect size in Amazon. I love New Balance shoes and always wanted a nice blue pair, could not find my size in the store so checked in Amazon. I got these for an attractive price and also these fit so well. Lightweight and very stylish!
customer_reviews.author: Abhisek Banerjee

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes on the market!!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are awesome! Fit as advertised!! I have all (5) versions (2 pair of v5’s). I loved these so much, I bought a second pair!! They feel great and were my “go to” shoes when I was a heavy runner.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Duty

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I don’t run but I’m on my feet all day on concrete. I bought another pair because they feel so good. Feet are happy.
customer_reviews.author: Bax

customer_reviews.title: Work for me
customer_reviews.text: This is a good shoe and works well for me. Your foot might be different. I use an arch insert and use these for walking for an hour 5 days a week. I'd buy them again when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Heard Of Me

customer_reviews.title: Consistent sizing and performance
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing New Balance since 2001. My go to brand for Marine Corps Running The only one that never gave me issues with shin splints and the fit is accommodating for my flat feet. I have used the same size shoe since my first purchase. Wish they were still made in USA
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R. Ohlrich

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable running shoe with good support
customer_reviews.text: These running shoes are very reasonable for the quality. I am using them on the treadmill and they are comfortable and offer very good arch support. They do run small, so I would advise to go up a half a size. I ordered my usual shoe size but had to return them and exchanged for larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Snappy, well developed running shoe
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought these in response to developing some 40 year old man knee pain during jogging. Knee pain resolved within a couple of days of wearing these shoes. A decent pair of running shoes makes a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: It feels a little tight at the beginning, but gets better after a few wears. Great support. I ordered the wide fit as recommended by my podiatrist.
customer_reviews.author: archi

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoe, Liked it so much bought it in black. I get a lot of compliments from people Who like this shoe. Please don’t ask questions I won’t answer them.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Ribaudo

customer_reviews.title: Love this shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is extremely comfortable and gives me lots of support following Achilles tendon surgery. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: dennis herman

customer_reviews.title: So far I like the shoes
customer_reviews.text: This pair of shoes are better than what I expected. Very fit to my feet and perform very well on the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Knit toe box is nice
customer_reviews.text: New Balance was won me back with their no frills innovation, playing to the core of what running sneakers are really intended and not marketing gimmicks. Feels good to be back! The knit toe box paired with just enough neutral structure throughout makes these a hit.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Pelosi

customer_reviews.title: Really good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the treadmill at home. I may buy another pair for everyday. They are pretty comfortable for my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Davey-Z

customer_reviews.title: Quality shoe with a true fit.
customer_reviews.text: The 890v6 has the perfect heel to toe drop (6mm) for my knees. All day comfort.
customer_reviews.author: DEXTER COCHNAUER

customer_reviews.title: They charge you for returns!
customer_reviews.text: The shoe product is fine but know your size for sure before you buy! Unlike normal Amazon transactions, these guys charge a fee for returns. New Balance shoes vary in size a bit with the style. These run a little small for me. It cost me $5 to find out. No exchanges either.
customer_reviews.author: McBobb

customer_reviews.title: Not very much cushion
customer_reviews.text: Thought they would be more comfortable and good for running
customer_reviews.author: Tina mclemore

customer_reviews.title: Loiked good but fit different
customer_reviews.text: Slipped off my heel. Ive ordered several of the New Balance. They seem to fit a little different.
customer_reviews.author: Rv customer

customer_reviews.title: Was a bit snug at first but fine now
customer_reviews.text: I wore them to work and didn't take them off! Wore them all day! Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Peter L. Sygnator

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! Lightweight, comfortable and durable. I’ve bought 3 pairs...
customer_reviews.author: J. Dungan

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: The fit is great. I put plenty of miles on these since buying them and will probably be getting another pair when these finally wear out. Great stuff, New Balance.
customer_reviews.author: SCOBAR

customer_reviews.title: They look nice and fit well!
customer_reviews.text: I have had them for a week now and I think they are very comfortable and a nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: My favorites!
customer_reviews.text: Love the 890v6 and hope that I can continue buying them! Have been through three pair thus far! Great shoe all around and I hope New Balance takes note of how much people loved this version.
customer_reviews.author: John Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great loose fitting minimal kinda running shoe .Soft feel Nice bounce for heel strikes
customer_reviews.author: Greg L

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but wrinkled
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy but material wrinkled after 1st use. Traded in for another set of NB with great reports.
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very similar to the v3 and v4 890s before they were discontinued. Hopefully New Balance will keep making these. Great shoe for both distance and speed work.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Dormish

customer_reviews.title: Best trainers so far(at least for me)
customer_reviews.text: First time using New Balance and so far they are the best trainers I have used. Mainly use them for sport practice for XC or runs on the weekend. The only thing I dislike is how the shoe sometimes irritates the heel of foot but nothing serious so far.
customer_reviews.author: K Rush

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love them, super comfortable, now we will see how they hold up
customer_reviews.author: Wilecat33

customer_reviews.title: Package delivered to wrong address
customer_reviews.text: Package was delivered to wrong address. Third time this has happened this year - each time two doors down. My house has very readable house numbers. Shoes are fine.
customer_reviews.author: robert r

customer_reviews.title: Favorite running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've got about 250 miles on these since buying. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Baxter Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My first time buying New Balance shoes. This is a light weight shoe. I like the appearance and design. The shoe is comfortable and offers good support
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of sneakers, most comfortable, that I ever bought!
customer_reviews.author: John Marino

customer_reviews.title: If arch support is important this model may not be for you.
customer_reviews.text: Not the quality I expect from this brand but are comfortable out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: jc in nyc

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!!
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great running shoe! Very comfortable and great for long runs. I've been using them to train for a half marathon.
customer_reviews.author: Allanon

customer_reviews.title: Narrow do not fit as other New Balance
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to these as the 880v9 2e fits great. I bought these in 2e width also and they are MUCH more narrow in the shoe box. I have to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Visocky

customer_reviews.title: toe box
customer_reviews.text: Love the cushion and support of the shoe but the toe box is a little small and tighter than other shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Light weight shoes
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are really light, the sole though may be too light, I am not convinced about how much they limit the impact on the leg
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light, fast, not big and bulky
customer_reviews.text: Fast, not to cushiony . Nice flex on the forefoot. Not bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Too small, order up
customer_reviews.text: Way too small, can't run in them. Threw away the box because I never got a bad pair of NB. Regret doing that now
customer_reviews.author: Thomas flynn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent running shoes
customer_reviews.text: NB did a great job here, used them in a Mararhon and tempo runs
customer_reviews.author: Netanel Popper

customer_reviews.title: Great runner for indoor
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent shoe will buy again in future
customer_reviews.author: phil bruno

customer_reviews.title: Too good for running
customer_reviews.text: Amazing pair ,very good for running on treadmill . I dont feel i'm actually running.
customer_reviews.author: Raghu

customer_reviews.title: The fit and comfort are what New Balance says it is.
customer_reviews.text: Fit my son perfectly. When I asked him how do they fit? Perfect ! I forgot I even had them on.
customer_reviews.author: heidi

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down my new favorite running shoe. Fits like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: whuffman03

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes at a good price, delivered ahead of schedule.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, but very hard souls.
customer_reviews.text: The soul is too hard. Not soft at all... however the sneakers are very light.
customer_reviews.author: The Awning Hut

customer_reviews.title: Toe width narrower than other NB running shoe models
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit well as compared to my 860 NB shoes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were not true to size. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Blevins

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, great price
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is great. It did fit a bit small. But, I really like it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Youngblood

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are perfect. They are light yet give support and have enough toe box to keep my get from feeling the squeeze.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Fits great look great and my knees no longer bother me from running on the treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Shipe

product_meta.title: New Balance - Mens M890W Shoes, 6.5 UK - Width 2E, White/Black
product_meta.description: Complete your outdoor look with the fresh new 890v6 sneakers from New Balance®. No-sew stretch mesh upper for durability and breathability. Lace-up closure for a secure and comfortable fit. 6 mm drop: due to variances created during the development and manufacturing processes, all references to 6 mm drop are approximate. Engineered mesh lining and footbed for all-day wear. REVlite foam midsole for additional support. Blown rubber outsole for extra durability. Imported. Measurements: Weight: 10 oz Product measurements were taken using size 12, width D - Medium. Please note that measurements may vary by size. Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
